text: Harold Eugene Ford Jr. (born May 11, 1970) is an American financial managing director, commentator, author, and former Democratic politician. From 1997 to 2007, he was a member of the United States House of Representatives from . He is the son of former Congressman Harold Ford Sr.. In 2006, Ford unsuccessfully ran for the U.S. Senate. He was also the last chairman of the Democratic Leadership Council (DLC).Barbaro, Michael, "Harold Ford Jr. Weighs a Challenge to Gillibrand", The New York Times, January 5, 2010 Between 2011 and 2017, Ford worked for Morgan Stanley as a managing director. He also appeared on television such as on NBC's Meet the Press, MSNBC, CNN, CNBC. Ford also wrote a book, More Davids Than Goliaths: A Political Education, published in 2010. In April 2021, Ford joined Fox News as a political commentator. He appears on Special Report as a panel member and was named a co-host of The Five in January 2022. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official Website * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Tennessee Category:Politicians from Memphis, Tennessee Category:American political commentators Category:Writers from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Businesspeople from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Fox News people Category:CNN people Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Harold Ford Jr.
